derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent. (denoting an abnormality of growth): from late Latin monstrositas, from Latin monstrosus (see monstrous)

entry.def: If you describe something, especially something large, as a monstrosity, you mean that you think it is extremely ugly.

example.ex: Most of the older buildings have been torn down and replaced by modern monstrosities.
example.tran: 大部分旧建筑已被拆除，取而代之的是丑陋的现代建筑物。

means.word_mean: 1. a person or animal that is markedly unusual or deformed

sentences.sentence: "they regarded the atom bomb as a monstrosity"

sentences.en: Everywhere you look,you can see glass and concrete monstrosities going up.
